intro: Monsonia praemorsa, commonly known as the death's-head hawkmoth plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking, velvety purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. It blooms throughout the year, attracting various pollinators such as birds and insects.
